Class FormattingOptions

    • Method Detail

      • formatFieldAsAttribute

        public void formatFieldAsAttribute(String fieldName,
                                   String attributeName)
        Tells to format a field as an attribute of the hit's tag. For instance, field 'query-latency' could be rendered as an attribute 'latency' by invoking formatFieldAsAttribute("query-latency", "latency"). Output would be: 
          <hit latency="100"></hit>
        instead of: 
          <hit><latency>100</latency></hit>

      • fieldsAsAttributes

        public Set<Map.Entry<String,String>> fieldsAsAttributes()

      • getAttributeName

        public String getAttributeName(String fieldName)

      • formatFieldWithSubtype

        public void formatFieldWithSubtype(String fieldName,
                                   String tagName,
                                   String typeAttributeName,
                                   String typeAttributeValue)
        Tells to format a field using a subtype. A subtype is used when there is kind of a grouping for a set of fields. For instance, fields 'latency-connect', 'latency-finish' all belong to the same 'latency' logical group. So invoking formatFieldWithSubtype("latency-connect", "latency", "type", "connect", formatFieldWithSubtype("latency-finish", "latency", "type", "connect" and so on, allows to have a common 'latency' tag name for all fields of the same kind. Note that it does no collapsing on tags. Output would be: 
         <latency type="connect">50</latency>
 <latency type="finish">250</latency>
        Instead of: 
         <hit>
   <latency-connect>50</latency-connect>
   <latency-finish>50</latency-finish>

      • getSubtype

        public com.yahoo.prelude.templates.FormattingOptions.SubtypeField getSubtype(String fieldName)

      • formatFieldWithSubtype

        public void formatFieldWithSubtype(String fieldNamePrefix,
                                   String tagName,
                                   String typeAttributeName)
        Same as formatFieldWithSubtype(String, String, String, String) except that fields are selected based on the beginning of their name and the type attribute value is deduced from the rest of their name. So this may select many fields instead of only one. Invoking formatFieldWithSubtype("latency-", "latency", "type") only once allows to have a common 'latency' tag name for all fields that start with 'latency-'. Type attribute value will be 'start' for field 'latency-start'. Note that it does no collapsing on tags. This is mostly used when you don't know all field names ahead. Output would be: 
         <latency type="connect">50</latency>
 <latency type="finish">250</latency>
        Instead of: 
         <hit>
   <latency-connect>50</latency-connect>
   <latency-finish>50</latency-finish>
        Note: don't use this with prefixes that start with a common substring (e.g. 'http', 'http_proxy'), I can tell you it just won't work.

      • getSubtypeWithPrefix

        public com.yahoo.prelude.templates.FormattingOptions.SubtypeFieldWithPrefix getSubtypeWithPrefix(String fieldName)

      • shouldRenderField

        public boolean shouldRenderField(String fieldName)
        Tells whether a field should be rendered.
        See Also:
        setFieldNotToRender(String), setFieldToRender(String)

      • setFieldToRender

        public void setFieldToRender(String fieldName)
        Tells a field should be rendered.

        Note: if at least one field is set to render, then only these fields should be rendered. Use setFieldNotToRender(String) to only exclude specific fields.

      • setFieldNotToRender

        public void setFieldNotToRender(String fieldName)
        Tells a field should not be rendered.

        Note: all other fields should be rendered. Use setFieldToRender(String) to only include specific fields.
